result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

D.T. s/t. Court heard; finds probable cause and binds over to Br 1; proceeds to arraignment. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't

8:19 AM Defendant Adam Christopher Morrison in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Def request to extend has retained attorney. Discussion on time limits. Def waives time limits. Victim rights compliant. Court reschedules PH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not go on the premises at victim residence. Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. No concerts.

12:47 PM Defendant Adam Christopher Morrison appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler appeared by video for Adam Christopher Morrison.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Unknown if eligible for SPD.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $500 cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or residence. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobrietyand shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. No concerts.  Shall make a phone call at countys expense for bond purposes.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at victims residence, may go one time with uniformed police officer to retrieve property.
Review hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
